level.heading: Fractional parts of dollar
level.text: With respect to any amount required to be shown on a return, document or statement filed under this chapter, if such amount is other than a whole-dollar amount, either the fractional part of a dollar shall be disregarded unless it amounts to one-half dollar or more, in which case the amount (determined without regard to the fractional part of the dollar) shall be increased by $1.

level.heading: Inapplicability to computation
level.text: The provisions of subsections (a) and (b) of this section shall not be applicable to items which must be taken into account in making the computations necessary to determine the amount required to be shown on a return, document or statement filed under this chapter, but shall be applicable only to such final amount.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-305 repealed subsec. (b) which had read:

"(b) Election not to use whole-dollar amounts. - Any person making a return, statement or other document shall be allowed to make such return, statement or document without regard to subsection (a) of this section."

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 4-118
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-118, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 47-1801.01a.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Section 410(a) of D.C. Law 13-305 provided: "(a) Section 402(a) applies for all tax years beginning after December 31, 2001."
